meanings.definition: To provide new financing for something already owned.
meanings.sent1: She refinances her car to get a lower interest rate.
meanings.sent2: He refinances his house to save money on monthly payments.
meanings.sent3: The family refinances their vacation home to afford a new boat.
meanings.sent4: The company refinances its debt to avoid bankruptcy.
meanings.sent5: Refinancing the business loan helps them expand their operations.

meanings.definition: To revise or restructure a loan agreement.
meanings.sent1: The bank refinances the mortgage to extend the repayment period.
meanings.sent2: They refinanced the student loan to lower the monthly installments.
meanings.sent3: John refinances his car loan and ends up paying less each month.
meanings.sent4: She refinances her personal loan to include a co-signer.
meanings.sent5: Refinancing the loan allows them to adjust the interest rate.

meanings.definition: The act of obtaining a new loan to replace an existing one.
meanings.sent1: His refinances of student loans helped him manage his debt.
meanings.sent2: The refinances of the business loans were necessary for growth.
meanings.sent3: The family's refinances of home loans allowed for renovations.
meanings.sent4: The refinances of car loans led to lower monthly payments.
meanings.sent5: Her refinances of personal loans improved her financial situation.
